Fields.DialogueText: Great timing, Cap! When I drop down on the deck, hop onto my port turret.
Er, on your port what?
Come on, this isn't gunnery plotting, Capitano. You look roughly as heavy as O'Rourke, and I want my handicap better balanced.
It's for a push-up demonstration.
In your dreams. It's to put these limp-wristed whiners in their place with a real set of push-ups!

Fields.MenuText: If you're that serious about balance, then drag a couple of AP shells out of your magazines.
O'Rourke? That's who you think I weigh closest to?
Standing on my ship is one thing... Standing on my Belle is a precedent I'd rather not make.

Fields.DialogueText: Just for a demonstration? Too much effort.
That's what you're worried about? I wouldn't have dragged you into this if I didn't think so.
Spare me the whole noble officer song and dance and just get on the turret.
*ALARM*
Looks like your competitive exercise will have to wait.
Hmph. So move it, people!
@BATTLE
Weak! Too weak! Hit the bag like you mean it!
Ten more, just like that. The tenth as hard as the first. Go!

Fields.MenuText: You heard the Belle. Don't stop on my account.
Pola, don't forget that you need your officers in one piece.
You can do this, Lieutenant. Make 'em count!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain.
It's all right, Captain. I was the one who asked her for a few pointers, so I'm prepared to feel this later.
Yes, Captain!
So what brings you ringside, Capitano?
Just to thank you again for sharing your insight into the crew, and coming up with this solution. I'm satisfied enough with the results.
So satisfied, in fact, that I'm lifting the ban on gambling.
Right. About that. If you'd like my insight, I'd suggest holding off until we're next in port.
The crew are well for now, so why not use lifting the ban as a reward to extend that? You know, to dangle in front of them like a carrot?
Not only that, but it gives the crew who can't go ashore a little on-ship entertainment. Something to soften the disappointment.
You don't say.
...The fact that you're in a pool on when I lift the ban wouldn't have anything to do with that either, now would it?
You're an accommodating sort, Capitano. It's vexing.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Training over, Lieutenant. Now watch how a professional does it.
Captain, there's an INPF representative from the Regia Marina dockside. Says she has a letter for Pola's eyes only.
Damn. Capitano, I think I can guess what the message is, so you aren't necessary.
What have you done this time?
Probably dredging without a permit. And if you want to maintain plausible deniability, you'll leave it at that.
Boiler number three is cold at the moment. ...Escort her to that boiler room and clear it - no questions asked.
Yes, Miss Pola.
Where are you going? That's not the fastest way to the boiler rooms.
To get a flask of something flammable. This is probably going to be an after-you-read-eat-this thing.
*SOME TIME LATER*
I see you just escorted your guest off. Were your suspicions confirmed?
Right down to the destroy after reading.

Fields.MenuText: So what does that secret note taste like?
This one of those if you told me, you'd have to kill me sorts of things?
Being in a position where you must keep something to yourself just to protect me and the crew is unenviable. Sorry I can't be of more support.

Fields.DialogueText: Airplane fuel...and disappointment.
Cap, have you ever wondered if there were situations where just asking that could get you in trouble? Not anymore...
Don't worry about that, Capitano. The more blissfully ignorant I can keep you, the better.
... Capitano, that patrol you sent up earlier is returning. It's making better time than expected, so I'll go put the recovery unit on standby.
I've still got time to reach the Observation bridge, right? I'll see you there.
Grazie.
The Fleet's too international for me to experiment, hmmm? There's more than one way to skin a cat...
Nice try, but I haven't forgotten your little fight club, Pola. Ignorance is rarely blissful.
*ALARM*
...Or a Morgana.
@BATTLE
Hmm... I can't help but wonder about what was in that letter.
Cap, Cap!
Any chance we could make a small detour?

Fields.MenuText: By all means! You found Morganas on the prowl for us?
Start by defining small for me, Pola.
Based on that grin of yours, it's more than just a detour. We have work to do, Pola.

Fields.DialogueText: Not yet, but I'm sure she has some ideas.
The port isn't that far out of our way, Cap, and just long enough to swing by and pick up some sailors Axum landed.
I know...but I just told Axum I'd help her out, and-
Axum? That's a surprise. I didn't think you two were that close.
We're not.
Then...?
I've bugging her for a while now to let me know when she has problem children.
They're few and far between in her case, but nobody's perfect.
And she has a bad apple for you?
In fact, she has two!
@BATTLE
She?
Axum.
Looks like we've got company on the way there. Try to treat our guests with respect.
I'll just make them fight for a bed if they get out of line.
Conditional cruelty is still cruelty.
Well, not if it can be avoided.
You know, Pola, all you had to say was that Axum was going to have to leave her station early if we didn't relieve her of these ''problem children''.
Or that they weren't bad discipline-wise, so much as suffering from the environment.
Details, Capitano, mere details. I wouldn't have diverted for just any Belle.
I wanted to get my hands on submariner rejects before they got to port and vanished. ...Or worse, before some other Belle snatched them up.

Fields.MenuText: But if you're that worried, doesn't diverting just for them tip your hand that you are in the market, so to speak?
Don't worry. Your secret heart of gold is safe with me.
Only you would actually want to be crewed by sailor rejects.

Fields.DialogueText: Good point. Okay, if anyone asks, I did it so Axum owes me a favor. ...Which she does...
That's what you think, Cap. ...That's the counterfeit 20-lire I keep next to my deck of marked cards and fiasco of chianti.
Depending on the issue, those are often the best kind, Capitano. They have something to prove.
So now that you've got them, what do you want them to do?
For now, show me they aren't completely ruined as sailors. They're as good to me as they were to Axum if any windowless bulkhead dredges up the same feelings.
Good point.
After that? We'll see.
@BATTLE
Why, here comes a potential case study now.
Well, Pola?
Hmm... You people made me break a sweat... two, maybe three sooner in the gauntlet this time.
Yeah!
Time for the next one!
Aww...
You single digits have had plenty of time to recover!
I can't do another one...
My arms feel like lead...

Fields.MenuText: Looks like you need another gauntlet, so you can rotate whole cohorts.
Be reasonable and find another way to push your endurance. This crew is only human.
If little labour, little are our gains: Man's fortunes are according to his pains.

Fields.DialogueText: I already have one for every day of the week, Cap. You're saying I need seven more?
Just when we were making progress.
There you have it, folks. Capitano says you need to hurt.
Pola, I think you're just going to have to face the fact that your crew is out of your weight class.
*ALARM*
Nothing like Morganas for motivation. I'll meet you on the bridge.
...Out of my weight class? Was that a...No. It's not worth it.
If the crew aren't in my weight class, then maybe it's time to fight someone who is!
@BATTLE
What's wrong, Captain?
Nothing on my end, but it looks like something has Pola in a bad mood.
You think so? She sounds normal to me.
Reza! There's grappa in the galley with my name on it. Bring it here and no one gets hurt.
Yes, Miss.
See? Perfectly normal.
Is there anything on your mind, Pola?
Cattive Ragazze nearby. The brawl will be soon, Capitano.
That close...

Fields.MenuText: Why are they that close? You know I hate brawls.
If we're brawling, we might as well be in for a whole pound than in for just a penny.
You've known they're out there for a while, haven't you? Mind letting me know we're in the middle of a game of cat-and-mouse before you pounce?

Fields.DialogueText: Too bad.
I agree. I can't tell how many there are, but I've made my peace with that.
What do you think this is?
How soon would you estimate?
Um, Miss Pola...the only bottle with your name on it was this open-
Il mio.
Pola, watch the - oh, now you've broken the neck off the bottle.
Ahh. Heh heh... Now that I'm armed, Capitano - as soon as I catch them.
...Should I start cleaning up the glass?
@BATTLE
Feeling better?
You're blowing it out of proportion, Capitano.
I was only a little disappointed in the twins.

Fields.MenuText: If that's you a little disappointed, let me know when you're beside yourself so I can call in sick.
Sorry. With you, it's hard to tell sometimes.
You need to learn to live with disappointment better, then. Belle or human, no one gets their way all the time.

Fields.DialogueText: So what will you do if I'm furious - call in dead?
Just find me a fight and all is forgiven.
I live with disappointment all the time. I picked you, after all.
Cheer up, fifty-fifty isn't bad. And you were right - I hear Damage Control is overjoyed to get someone with diving skills.
Eh? ...Oh, right.
Thanks for reminding me, Cap... I know just the Belle to transfer the other one to.
...You mean the claustrophobia case still under sedation in the Infirmary? Pola, the only ship I think he's still good for is a stone frigate.
Heh heh heh...
@BATTLE
Did you hear the latest rumor?
What, that there's ships that really do have Belles, except they're so cowardly that they pretend to not be awake?
That's the oldest rumor in the Fleet...
No, no. Listen - I heard from a stevedore, who heard from an ensign on a repair ship, who heard from a tug's commanding officer...
Who heard a Belle talking about a rumor that our Pola challenged another Belle to a fight!
Really!? Who? When? Did they fight?
Story goes that the other Belle is one of the old salts of the Fleet-
Like our Pola-
And that she - the other Belle, I mean - chickened out!
Preposterous. Pola would have said something about it by now if it was true.
If someone's spreading hogwash about Pola...!
We could always ask...
No! Wait-!
Hey, Miss Pola!
Hold that thought Cap... What?
Is it really true that you challenged another Belle to a fight, and she turned you down?
If I had challenged anyone, do you really think I'd take 'no' for an answer?
What I did do is float the idea of setting up a goodwill exhibition. An acquaintance checked it for seaworthiness, and the answer she sent was that we aren't ready.
How rude! Who was it, Pola?
Yeah! We'll show her-
When your fists move half as fast as your mouths do, I'll let you know. Until then, stop sponging up rumors and get back to your posts!
Yes, Pola.
Aye, Pola.

Fields.MenuText: So...can I ask you how honest you were back there, without getting yelled at?
Pola, you actually have acquaintances? I'm so proud of you!
You do realize their fists are never going to move that fast, Pola. Is that your way of saying it's a lost cause?

Fields.DialogueText: No.
...Do you have a preference for which eye I blacken, or can I hit you between them and get both?
No. ...But if they aren't ready when I get this set up, I'll clear the deck myself.
@BATTLE
Now stay out of my way while I show you a real fight.
Pola, about this requisition...
Yeah, I know. The main bag is a lost cause, but there's someone down in laundry who has practical experience with leather and canvas...
I'm not talking about the punching bags. I'm referring to this... look here.
Oh, the rebreathers. Those are for spearfishing.
They are?
Certainly. It's a lot easier to get close to fish if you aren't blowing bubbles.

Fields.MenuText: You're not joking.
What kind of sea life did you have in mind to hunt exactly? Because if you have your eyes on Nautilus, or Salmon...
Knowing this crew, it's a given that those who don't find fisticuffs a relaxing pastime would gravitate to shoving a pointy stick through marine fauna instead...

Fields.DialogueText: Not a bit, Cap. I bet you have no idea they're used by firefighters and miners, too.
I have no intention of using one, so the fish-girls are safe from me.;
I can think of worse hobbies, Cap.
All right. But they aren't cheap...
Don't worry, Nowak's covering the bill.
Maybe he should take the hint and stop playing poker with you.
@BATTLE
Oh good.
...My crew, on the other hand...
Did you say something?
No. ...Heh.
Unfortunately, so can I.
I pray every night he never does.
*ALARM*
Think God listens?
Hmm... Sometimes, Capitano.
What's that mean?
Can't hear you. Morganas.
Good job, Goldfish.
Ha! Goldfish? What kind of worthless nickname is that?
It's what the submarine reject gets until she earns a better one.
Does she know what you're looking for to earn it, Officer?
...I...thought that would be obvious, Pola.
Goldfish. You know, I like it. Hey, Cap, I've got my very own goldfish!
Something the matter?
...No, Ma'am.
Something should be, Goldfish.
Eh?
If you don't like something, say so. If you're tired of being insulted, don't take it lying down - take it into the ring.
B-but...

Fields.MenuText: Pola, you stink at explaining unwritten rules.
What Pola is telling you is that on this ship, you will continue to be insulted by people who actually mean well, until you fight someone.
This would all be easier, Pola, if you just made a match with you part of every new salor's initiation.

Fields.DialogueText: That's part of learning the ropes. But if you insist in me spelling it out in black and white, Capitano, have it your way.
In not so many words. But yeah, that.
Bonding through shared experience, and I get to fight everyone at least once. I really like the sound of that, Cap!
You're here because I want you here. For your talents alone, you're worth your weight in gold.
But I'm a big ship, with a large crew. You're just another misbegotten child of Neptune to the rest - until you prove your mettle.
So you will get pushed, until they've seen how 'one of us' you are.
But... My boxing is no good.
So?
It's not about whether you win or lose, it's about the amount of fire in your guts.
Yup. And don't worry, boxing can be taught. Knowing how much someone will take from you and vice versa is something you learn.
But you either have fight in you, or you don't.
So there you have it. Understand?
Aye-aye, Captain! Captain, Miss Pola, if you will excuse me a moment...
You, sir, are a piss-poor officer. I will see you in the ring, and I'll do my best not to kick your ass.
That's some strong words from someone who doesn't know how to box, Goldfish.
My boxing is no good, because I have to remember not to use my feet - I'm a tireuse.
You know that French style... what was it?... savate? Then that settles it - you'll fight me first.
@BATTLE
Anyway, Goldfish, it's like this...
...Or second. Morganas...always jumping to the head of the line.
Uh, Pola? You're not angry again, are you?
Whatever gave you that idea?
Maybe the look that could scorch paint?
Not now, Capitano. I've found a target to vent my rage on.
@BATTLE
Better now?
Somewhat. I'm still left with a bitter taste in my mouth. Time to cure that with large quantities of vino.
It's that bad, huh?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe I can help. I'm not just here for the stunning good looks, you know.
They say the secret to long life is to not holding on to stress. If that's true, Pola, you're going to live forever. ME, on the other hand...
Care to fill your captain in, Pola? I'm a decent listener, if nothing else.

Fields.DialogueText: True, Cap - you're here to give me reason to roll my eyes...
I intend to live as long as I get to fight, Capitano. Whether that duration equals until tomorrow or after the stars have all fallen from the sky makes no difference to me.
Fine. I might as well?
Remember the rumor that I'd challenged another Belle to a fight, and she refused?
Yeah. You said it wasn't exactly true, she just felt you and the crew aren't ready yet.
It is now. I contacted her directly, and she declined my offer. The nerve!
I'm sure she had her reasons, Pola. She's probably more focused on the war.
You're saying I am not?
No, I'm not. Belles are all different. Maybe her focus is different than your focus.
It is inferior! We are revolutionary spirits, Capitano! We believe in intervention! If I detect weakness in myself or in my sister, is it not my duty to hammer it into shape?
For what it's worth, I don't detect weakness in you.
Never have.
W-well, clearly you're not looking hard enough! I should have picked a more discerning Capitano!
You mean you've got weaknesses I haven't detected?
I...that is...um...
Sta 'zitto!
So that's what she looks like when she's flattered.
Hmph... *hic*
You really had your heart set on a match, didn't you.
I'd like to know who turned you down, Pola.

Fields.MenuText: I'd like to find out who in the Fleet is dumb enough to insult my ship.
There's got to be some extenuating circumstances, since you asked nicely. ...You did ask nicely, right?
I can't have a fighting chance to duck the next time I'm standing between you if I don't.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm a heavy cruiser. I can fight *hic* my own battles.
Do I look that uncultured to *hic* you? Of course I asked nicely!
I don't want to. ...You, dancing to stay out of line of sight between me and every *hic* other Belle in the Fleet? Heh, heh...
Exactly how did you ask, then? What terms were you offering?
Terms? *hic* Let me think... Right. She'd said before that I and my crew, we weren't ready. Soooo, I offered to leave the crews *hic* out and go just have a Belle-to-Belle match.
She said no thanks.
Then she did refuse to fight you. Whoever she is, she must've had some reason...
Well, if she won't be accomodating, I guess we'll just have to find you Morganas who will.
@BATTLE
Except this one, apparently, because she won't fight.
...Not helping, Cap.
You're welcome.
Hmph. Gioco da ragazzi.
You sobered up quick.
Battle will do that.
Thank goodness. I wasn't keen on finding out what a drunk Belle fought like.
Oh, make no mistake, Capitano. The wine is hammering at the gates. I will hold it off just long enough to apologize.
For what?
In... your own way... you were trying to help the other day. I recognize that now. In truth, I...well.
I could tell you were hurting. What kind of captain would I be if I didn't address it?
I wouldn't have chosen you otherwise. It... it just goes to show what a superb judge of character I am!
Are you blushing, Pola?
A Bella Phantasma does not blush!
...Scusi. Permission to pass out.
Granted. I'll leave you some water.
I'd say look what washed ashore, except we're at high tide.
You people have a perfectly good facility on board! There's absolutely no reason to go off this ship just to pound on other people!
The MP's have already given me the deposition from the other side. Now, It's your turn to explain... Let's start with you.
Certainly, Capitano! It's like this - we were just minding our own business, when a bunch of lowlife squids came up and started giving Goldfish here grief--
I thought she'd earned a new nickname by now.
She did, Captain. I'd give her one, except she's owned "Goldfish."
Besides, Pola said she liked it.

Fields.MenuText: I see.
If you had any lingering doubts whether you belong, you can put them to rest... Welcome to Pola's loyal pack of lunatics, Goldfish.
Since it sounds like this incident has to do with you, Goldfish, part of your punishment is to brighten Pola's day by any means necessary.

Fields.DialogueText: ...I do, too.
Thank you, Captain!
Aye-aye, Captain! I shall do that to the best of my abilities, sir.
You were saying...?
Oh, right. Well, we weren't about to let them get away with that.
Yeah! You told 'em when you said they were pond scum!
...I feel a migraine coming on.
Then they called our ship a... A chum bucket!
Definitely a migraine.
Now, being an officer, I felt it within my scope to remind them they were slandering our ship.
...In three, two...
And then the slugs called Pola a shameless coward!
Sigh...
Look, people. The docks and Pola's decks are separate places.
Get some thicker skin, because if you intend to clobber each and every submariner with a superiority complex, this is going to be a long war!
Begging your pardon, but they weren't pig-boaters, Captain.
Fine. Then you know and I know Pola isn't a coward, but goading another Belle's crew still isn't going to make her change her mind and fight Pola!
WHAT!? There really is some bottom-feeder who doesn't have the guts to take Pola's lumps?
Captain, the other crew was questioning my sanity. They said Pola recommended Baker to their Belle.
The other sailor from Axum? Mister strap-down-and-full-sedation? That Baker??
Never mind that! What's this about some yellow-bellied Belle snubbing Pola!?
Give us her name, Captain!
...Crap.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Saved by the bell...
Amazing. Moored in deep water since I can't even send out a steward without incident, the Fleet threatening to slap us with an armed guard and distemper shots, and you're down here -
Or what - throwing the crew into a bigger frenzy by pretending to try and drown yourself?
The subs know better than to stay below while in port, Cap. Non-Belle destroyer crews will depth charge Scilla and Phantasma the same way.
...And I'm not the one who dumped fuel oil all over the crew.

Fields.MenuText: I know, I know. Mea culpa.
You're not even going to respond to the drowning yourself thing?
This time.

Fields.DialogueText: ...Well, like fuel oil, this too will burn itself out in time.
That didn't even rate an eye roll, Cap.
...Heh heh.
In the meantime, I'm checking on the progress of my goldfish. The rebreathers arrived, remember?
Right. She catch anything yet?
Catch? Oh, no. Goldfish knows how to use a rebreather, but she hasn't got the hang of the spear yet. It's more of a blind man's cane, at this point.
If you want, I'll keep a spearfishing instructor in mind when I'm looking for more crew.
That's... Not necessary, Capitano.
But...
An instructor? For a hobby that at best only a handful of the crew would be interested in?
I guess you have a point.
If she continues to have trouble, I'll just pull in a favor and have an acquaintance give her some pointers.
*TAPTAP*
Hang on, Capitano.
There. She's heading up to the surface now.
Going topside to meet her? Go ahead, it's keeping you out of trouble.
Frying pans and fires, Capitano. We have company.
@BATTLE
- Making rude gestures at passing submarines. Have you a point, Capitano?
Capitano, I have a message for you, from Axum.
Go ahead.
''You're very kind''. Ha! What's she talking about?

Fields.MenuText: You don't agree with her?
She's probably referring to the package I sent her.
I don't need your permission to interact with other Belles in the Fleet, Pola.

Fields.DialogueText: Depends on whatever sappy thing you did.
Oh, is that all?
No, but... Grr.
I sent her a gift basket and a card. I know it was just a transfer and all, but after seeing how much fun you got out of your boxing-versus-savate bout, I thought it would be a nice gesture.
Hmph... I could have done that.
Were you going to?
Then I rest my case.
*ALARM*
I'll see you on the bridge.
Right.
...A gift basket. Hmmmm...
@BATTLE
I'm back.
With Reza?
They turned him over to me, yes. He's confined to quarters for now.
Did he manage to get the stuff?
Ugh. That finally explains why he went AWOL in the first place.
I'll take that as a no, then. Oh, well...
Pola, come back here. Was this really necessary? We may be stuck under MP detail, but we can still get deliveries.
So you weren't able to drag it out of Reza, huh?

Fields.MenuText: I thought I'd save the hot poker and thumbscrews until we got back here.
I thought I'd cut to the chase and find out from you, instead.
I know any threat I could make pales next to what you're actually capable of, Pola.

Fields.DialogueText: Oooh, oooh! Can I watch?
That's if you can.
You flatter me.
Pola...
Okay, okay. I sent him out for gift basket supplies.
Axum's response to the one you sent her got me thinking, so I wanted to assemble something for someone else.
Who, that other Belle? To show you aren't still mad she turned you down? That's-
To see if I can still get that match by greasing her skids.
... That was almost thoughtful of you, Pola.
It still is, Capitano. If I did all this above board, as they say, what do you think my crew would do? They'd treat it as a kiss of death!
They would, wouldn't they... Then never mind what I said before - that's damn thoughtful of you!
So thoughtful, in fact, that I want to help you succeed with it.
...We've got orders coming in on the wireless.
My offer is still on the table, Pola.
Your track record at keeping secrets kind of stinks at the moment, Cap...but I'll keep it in mind.
@BATTLE
Pola, about this list...
What, you can't read it?
I can read it just fine. It's what's on it that I'm wondering about.
Is this all stuff for the basket, or did you lace this list with things you like too? Because if I didn't know any better, I'd say the whole basket was for you.
You're being rude, Capitano. Of course it's all meant for her basket. ...I just don't know what she likes, so I thought I'd send her a few of my favorite things.
That would explain the Chianti from four different wineries...

Fields.MenuText: Your lack of gift-giving expertise is unsurprising. ...And adorable...
That's certainly thoughtful...but...
Would you be offended if I made a few suggestions?

Fields.DialogueText: ...You've been warned-
The thought alone isn't enough for this one.
Since you are the one who has to go out and get it all, go right ahead. They'd better be suggestions of high quality though - a shoddy gift is no gift, capisce?
@BATTLE
So, your wisdom on proper gifts...?
Right. If you really are trying to make the best impression, then you need to tailor it to what she likes.
But I already told you-
You don't know. Which is why I need to have a name, Pola.
I know this is your fight, but if you want it delivered to her I'll need to know who she is eventually. Why not tell me now, instead of later?
Fine.
She's one of the American Belles.
Signorina Salt Lake City.
Wait! Wait! I didn't say you were adorable! I'd find it endearing in anyone! Honest!!
Is that the alarm? *whew!* Saved by the Morganas!
Well said.
Wait - do you hear that? Thoughtfulness later - gleefully sinking Morganas now!
Loud and clear.
You can make your suggestions later. Those Morganas are still afloat, so I need to correct their buoyancy issues.

Fields.MenuText: You don't do things by half, do you...
And you?! Bwaahahahah!
As in that Salt Lake City?

Fields.DialogueText: What's that supposed to mean, Cap? I want to confirm for myself that those gloves of hers aren't for show.
Yeah, yeah, laugh it up at my expense. Get it out of your system now, because if you so much as chuckle the next time you use her name and mine in the same breath, I will rearrange your face.
Yes, as in that Salt Lake City...! Why wouldn't I want to challenge her?
Not Algérie? Or at least, Achilles...?
Algérie uses knives. A knife fight between she and I - even to first blood - would not for the faint of heart.
Good point. Pun not intended.
As for that Greek from Britanniae, I already know her well.
We play a little ludus latrunculorum, I insult her, she insults me, we pound each other until somebody breaks us up and start all over. Hours of fun!
So, you set your sights on Salt Lake City...
Sì.
And you went so far as to propose a match with her. Which she politely declined.
Sì.
So you're hoping a gift basket will change her mind.
You have a better idea?
Actually, I do. First, we need to get out of sitting in the Fleet's detention corner...
*ALARM*
After I put those Morganas in their place, I'm on it, Cap!
@BATTLE
They aren't.
All the more reason to test my mettle against hers.
Heh. Sorry. Just had a temporary lapse of sanity, there.
Yes, but...Salt Lake City?
So. Salt Lake City?
Make it quick, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Next! Hey, watch the splash!
Pola, usually the punishment is supposed to fit the crime. This...
I'm not punishing the entire crew. Just the ringlead-
A-HA! Reel him in!
Captain, hel--
Closer...closer...and...ha!
Well, well. Look what I caught!
*APPLAUSE*
What have we here? I believe it's a Starshy Leytenant-fish!
He's too small! Throw him back!
...Well?
...No more ambushing other Belle crews without permission. I promise.
Down you go!
Aaaaaahhhhh!
Give me the other pole while you let him loose.
Here you go, Pola.
*SPLASH*
Another great cast, by yours truly!

Fields.MenuText: That cord better have sufficient breaking strength, Pola.
I was almost willing to let this little game slide until the "without permission" part. No more ambushes period, Pola.
Hold on - I remember seeing a net somewhere...

Fields.DialogueText: The line is fine, Cap. ...I've been through a couple of poles so far, though.
And tie my hands completely? You don't know me very well, do you?
That's what the blunted gaff hook is for. Make sure to snag just the vest.
I take it the goal is from the accommodation ladder to that boat.
Mmm Hmmm. Next!
*SPLASH*
The boat is empty.
That's because no one has managed to get past my goldfish yet. The first couple got close...
Goldfish? What in the world-
Trying a different brand of goggles. Based on the results so far, these are working much better.
Ah, she just got the snare on his leg!
*SPLASH*
Ooh, I think I've got a trophy sottocapo this time!
No one's lost an eye, I take it.
Sì. So it's still all fun and games!
I just wanted to tell you good luck. I know you've been busy lately, so if anything's on your mind...
...Grazie, Capitano. You of all people should know I never let anything put me off my game.
Least of all compliments on your gift-wrapping prowess.
I - that is - Hmph. Get the crew to action stations or I'll whip them there.
Too easy.
All right boys and girls, your leaders have been chastised, but that doesn't mean you're innocent!
Since it didn't take the last time, let's review! All of you, repeat after me: I am an adult!
I am an adult!
As an adult, I recognize that there are better uses of my time on shore leave than pummeling the adults of every other ship in the Fleet!
As an adult, I recognize that there are better uses of my time on shore leave than pummeling the adults of every other ship in the Fleet!

Fields.MenuText: As an adult, I ALSO know that ''adult'' includes - but is not limited to - ship's mascots, MPs, harbor personnel, civilians and pets!!
I can't hear you!
We're all supposed to be on the same side, people! The Morganas work together better than we do! Is that something you're proud of? Well?!

Fields.DialogueText: As an adult...
As an adult, I recognize that there are BETTER uses of my time on shore leave than pummeling the adults of EVERY OTHER ship in the Fleet!!
No, Captain!
Do NOT get the bright idea to use violence for intel purposes again!
...Or so help me, I WILL give Pola permission to extract what intel you learn out of you using the same techniques you used to get it in the first place!
Heh heh...
Am I crystal clear?
Yes, Captain!
Dismissed to action stations. The Morganas could be anywhere in these waters.
The Fleet isn't going to believe we've turned over a new leaf that easily, mi Capitano.
No. But it's still a start. You're going to make sure it takes.
Then prove it. Behave yourselves.
Much better.
I don't have to like it.
No, no you don't. I guess you'll just have to find more surreptitious ways to keep your sisters on their toes.
Surreptitious, you say?
So internecine strife is frowned upon. Big deal. You're Pola. Your crew blows off steam by knocking each other senseless in a controlled environment.
You'll find a way to control this one.
When you put it that way, Capitano, it sounds almost...
Helpful?
Deceptive. Like you're trying to appease me.
That's not what I -
Fermare. I like it. You are learning your place in my -
*BOOM*
Cattive Ragazze! Adults are talking!
@BATTLE
I still think the gift basket would've worked.
I don't. Not based on your supply list - you have no clue about what Salt Lake City would want. ...Coffee?
She is American.
...Venchi Nougatine?
Who doesn't love a little chocolate?
Vin Santo? All that Chianti?
Hey! I had to work to narrow it down to the best vintage samples!
Ugh... Never mind.
Quick confirmation here, but I need to ask. You had every intention of playing...fair. Right?
Of course, Capitano! She's no Morgana!

Fields.MenuText: Like I said, I was sure of the answer myself. I still felt I needed to hear it from you, though.
Whew.
So, with the rest of us you only cheat after a first date? Good to know.

Fields.DialogueText: Makes sense.
Signorina Salt Lake City would have to be more insulting than a simple refusal to play with me for that.
Ha ha. Of course there are exceptions, even among the Fleet. Signorina Salt Lake City just doesn't happen to be one in this case.
Pola, I know how hard you cultivate your reputation for being nasty and ruthless, but there's always been the possibility of that coming back to haunt you.
Consider it officially no longer a possibility.
You asked!?
I thought it didn't hurt to go straight to the source.
So that was why... Not because she thought it a waste of her time...or that I'm so tiny she'd hurt me...
Huh. This feeling, Capitano... it seizes at my chest, almost like...
Flattery?
@BATTLE
Certamente. That is what I was arriving at. That specifically.
*ALARM*
Join me in some pummeling, Capitano?
Delighted.
All right, Pola. How badly do you really want a match with Salt Lake City?
What do you mean?
I believe I can convince her. All the good that can come of it is still there, and she's not unreasonable.
What I need from you is your word that you'll play by the rules. Arm me with that, and I know I can convince her.
You could always just order me, you know.

Fields.MenuText: I could. I'd rather not. I'm not the one who has to slug it out with her, so I'd rather not accidentally tie your hands.
And you could use it as an excuse if you lose. "I could have won, if my captain hadn't shackled me."
Why bother? You'd just use every loophole I left available. The sincerity to play fair has to come from you, Pola.

Fields.DialogueText: Beneath my dignity.
Besides, you're not a child. You know how to play nice with others, even if you don't always demonstrate it.
True.
You said so yourself, Capitano.
I'd give you my word for that reason alone. Throw in her reputed skill, and being able to box at our full strength and endurance? Oh, it makes me giddy just thinking about it!
Cap, you have my word as a Zara-class cruiser that I'll play fair and honorably.
Then lace your gloves, Pola.
@BATTLE
Yes, it is. It's also something your crew would howl if that happened, and you know it.
Apetta un minuto... Grr. Morganas. They are occasion enough.
Group two! Lets go!
*GROAN*
Don't give me that! You've had a whole group to recover!
It sounds like I have good news and bad news. The good news is that it's official. Salt Lake City accepts.
*APPLAUSE*
...And the bad news?
Since Salt Lake City accepts your challenge, you're going to be pushing your sparring partners that much harder.
*GROAN*

Fields.MenuText: ...Which for me is wonderful news, because you people won't have any energy leftover for shore leave shenanigans.
I'm sure you'll be able to commiserate with Saltshaker's crew.
Look on the bright side. You'll have the pride of fighting Pola at her strongest.

Fields.DialogueText: Three cheers!
*ALARM*
Group Two! You're on hold until we finish this battle, then get your butts back here!
*GROAN*
@BATTLE
Not so fast, Capitano.
I didn't do it.
Assurdo. You did everything. I must thank you properly.
My quarters after sparring. We drink to the true test of skill.
You're that confident we'll win today?
This one too.
I didn't think you'd leave ringside until the match.
You're still lining up a hostess, right? I do know how to pace myself.
And I almost forgot your goldfish. Has she managed to catch anything yet?
Yeah, a raging head cold. I have her holding off diving again until her sinuses can properly drain.

Fields.MenuText: No, you don't have to. It makes me glad to know you're choosing to.
You might want to think about showing a little less favoritism, Pola. She's liable to attract unwanted attention as your pet project.
...So, what are you making her do out of the water instead?

Fields.DialogueText: Come now, Cap! I'm a firm believer that a little adversity breeds character, but I'm not evil.
You worry too much, Cap. Remember when I went fishing for troublemakers?
Learn a few new tricks...heh, heh.
Oh, I almost forgot...if Nerpa was to find herself overcrowded...
Let me guess. Another detour? How many submariners do you want?
At least one more to be a dive partner for Goldfish...but, the more the merrier.
And I suppose you have a nickname already picked out?
...Well...
Don't name your guppies before they're in your tank, Pola. In the meantime, let's see about arranging a change of course. We're in bad waters today.
@BATTLE
Pneumonia. What does she think I am, a hospital ship?
A fellow Belle doing her a good turn. And if you want to fish like this, Pola, you're just going have to be patient.
Ugh. I don't, Capitano.
Especially if you didn't have to...
Just thinking out loud here, but it occurs to me that raiding someone else's fishbowl is probably as blatant as going to a pet shop.
But if I brought some fish back like that, you'd probably have to kill me. Am I right?
Well...the port authorities at the very least would have a fit if they found out about my hobby.
That's probably putting it mildly. They'd probably quarantine your fishbowl and fine you.
I wondered why you've shied away from a brand spanking new aquarium. You know, with all the belles and whistles.
Sì. I can explain the hand-me-downs that just happened to float my way. Anything fancy? Forget it.
Then you have to stop loitering around the breeders and admire some fishbowls from afar, Pola.
On the other hand, if a few of your acquaintances picked a fish up, traded it amongst themselves, got bored or discovered it was too aggressive for their aquariums...
...And then gave it to me...
Then that fish wouldn't really be from the breeder anymore, now would it?
That would leave more Belles aware of my hobby...but I guess that's a small price to pay to have it.
Huh! You're awfully impressive, did you know that?
Careful, Pola, that sounded kind of mushy.
There, see? That's the eye roll that I'm used to.
Hmph... Mushy or not, you're still awfully impressive... I think I could grow to really like you.
Unfortunately.
Unfortunately for whom?
I think Officer Reza might disagree with you, there.
Yes...
The boys and girls I was annoyed with only had to be in the water long enough to try for a boat. Goldfish was in the water as my hook and as lifeguard for every single one of them.
So special status like hers is not only unenviable, it takes a rare kind of lunacy to want. Good to know.
For whoever sees me do this.
...Goodness.
More where that came from, Capitano. I will warn you next time.
